meta.title: Operational Selmer Geometry and the Birch-Swinnerton-Dyer Conjecture
meta.subtitle: A Coherence-Theoretic Approach to Rank Equality
meta.author: Zelenka_D_D

citations.cite_as: Zelenka, D.D. (2025). Operational Selmer Geometry and the Birch-Swinnerton-Dyer Conjecture: A Coherence-Theoretic Approach to Rank Equality.

abstract: We present an operational framework for the Birch-Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture that reinterprets the classical problem as a stability theorem relating analytic collapse dimensions to algebraic coherence dimensions. Rather than treating elliptic curves as accessible geometric objects, we develop a theory of operational attractors approached through finite approximations, with Selmer groups as the primary arithmetic interface. Our main contribution isolates BSD into three explicit gaps: (A) prime-independence of Selmer coherence rank [RESOLVED UNCONDITIONALLY], (B) existence of arbitrary-rank derived Euler systems [REDUCED TO BLOCH-KATO + PERRIN-RIOU], and (C) analytic saturation bounds [RESOLVED CONDITIONALLY VIA IWASAWA THEORY]. Our framework respects an operational non-invertibility principle: no proof step reconstructs algebraic data from analytic singularities using metric invariants. This clarifies why BSD rank equality is achievable without heights, regulators, or explicit rational points, while the full leading coefficient formula requires fundamentally different techniques.

Axiom_1_Operational_Non_Invertibility.label: Operational Non-Invertibility Principle
Axiom_1_Operational_Non_Invertibility.statement: Any arithmetic operation that collapses information into a singular state (e.g., analytic vanishing at s=1) is non-invertible. No proof step may attempt to reconstruct algebraic data from such a collapse using metric, scalar, or limiting procedures.
Axiom_1_Operational_Non_Invertibility.interpretation: This axiom forbids reconstructing algebraic rank from the leading coefficient L^(r)(E,1) using heights, regulators, or periods. It explains why rank equality (dimensional) is provable without metric data, while the full BSD formula (metric refinement) requires fundamentally different techniques.
consequences: Proof must be functorial and categorical
Only coherence dimensions (not metric invariants) can be compared
Rank equality separates from leading coefficient formula

elliptic_curve.definition: An elliptic curve over Q, treated as an operational attractor approached through finite approximations (reductions mod p, Galois representations E[p^n], p-adic approximations)
elliptic_curve.properties: Never directly accessed; only approached through finite shadows

selmer_group.definition: Kernel of H^1(Q, E[p^n]) → ∏_v H^1(Q_v, E[p^n])/H^1_f(Q_v, E[p^n])
selmer_group.interpretation: Space of all finite-level operational approximations to E that are locally consistent everywhere
selmer_group.role: Primary interface for probing unobtainable curve

selmer_core.interpretation: Stable limit of all finite-depth approximations; natural home for algebraic rank

analytic_rank.definition: Order of vanishing of L(E,s) at s=1: r_an(E) := ord_{s=1} L(E,s)
analytic_rank.interpretation: Dimension of global operational incoherence at the attractor

algebraic_rank.classical_equivalence: Agrees with Mordell-Weil rank rank_Z E(Q) by descent theory
algebraic_rank.interpretation: Dimension of stable core of inverse Selmer tower; number of independent operational threads persisting through all truncations

Bloch_Kato.statement: For elliptic curve E/Q and prime p: ord_{s=1} L(E,s) = dim_{Q_p} H^1_f(Q, V_p(E))
Bloch_Kato.status: Proven for modular curves with r_an ≤ 1 (Kato 2004, Skinner-Urban 2014)
Bloch_Kato.role: Provides dimension matching for Gap B

Perrin_Riou_Reciprocity.statement: Big exponential map Ω_{E,p} intertwines p-adic L-function L_p(E,s) with global Selmer classes in H^1(Q, V_p(E))
Perrin_Riou_Reciprocity.status: Established for crystalline representations at good ordinary primes
Perrin_Riou_Reciprocity.role: Bridges analytic obstructions to cohomological persistence for Gap B

Iwasawa_Main_Conjecture.statement: Characteristic ideal char_Λ(X(E/Q_∞)) = (L_p(E,s)) where X(E/Q_∞) is Pontryagin dual of Selmer tower
Iwasawa_Main_Conjecture.role: Controls analytic saturation for Gap C

Greenberg.status: Verified computationally for extensive families; expected to hold generally
Greenberg.role: Ensures clean Iwasawa structure for Gap C

Lemma_Persistence_Criterion.label: lem:persistence
Lemma_Persistence_Criterion.statement: An element of S_p(E) corresponds to a compatible family of Selmer classes surviving all finite truncations.
Lemma_Persistence_Criterion.role: Justifies interpretation of Selmer core elements

Lemma_Freeness.label: lem:freeness
Lemma_Freeness.statement: The subgroup of S_p(E) generated by independent persistent threads is a free Z_p-module.

Lemma_Classical_Rank_Compatibility.label: lem:classical-rank
Lemma_Classical_Rank_Compatibility.statement: Under standard descent theory, r_alg(E) = rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) agrees with Mordell-Weil rank rank_Z E(Q).
Lemma_Classical_Rank_Compatibility.role: Connects operational definition to classical invariant

Lemma_GapA_Prime_Independence.label: lem:gapA
Lemma_GapA_Prime_Independence.statement: For each prime p, the Z_p-rank of S_p(E) is independent of p.
proof_outline: Step 1: Kummer map injects E(Q) ⊗ Z_p → S_p(E), giving rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) ≥ r for all p
Step 2: Exact sequence 0 → E(Q) ⊗ Q_p/Z_p → Sel_{p^∞}(E) → Sha(E)[p^∞] → 0 yields rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) = r + corank_{Z_p} Sha(E)[p^∞]
Step 3: Poitou-Tate duality shows Sha(E)[p^∞] arises from global classes independent of p, hence corank is p-independent

Lemma_Derived_Cohomology.label: lem:derived-cohom
Lemma_Derived_Cohomology.statement: H^1(RΓ_f(Q, T_p(E))) ≅ Hom_{Z_p}(E(Q) ⊗ Z_p, Q_p/Z_p) and H^2(RΓ_f(Q, T_p(E))) ≅ Hom_{Z_p}(Sha(E)[p^∞], Q_p/Z_p)
Lemma_Derived_Cohomology.role: Recovers classical invariants from derived framework

main_theorem.label: thm:main
main_theorem.statement: Let E/Q be an elliptic curve and p a prime of good ordinary reduction. Assume: (1) Bloch-Kato conjecture for E and p, (2) Perrin-Riou p-adic reciprocity framework for E/Q_∞, (3) Iwasawa Main Conjecture for E/Q_∞, (4) Greenberg's conjecture μ(E/Q_∞) = 0. Then ord_{s=1} L(E,s) = rank_Z E(Q).

gap_decomposition.statement: rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) is independent of p

gap_decomposition.gap: Gap B: Arbitrary-Rank Derived Euler Systems
gap_decomposition.statement: For r_an(E) = r, there exists functorial morphism Φ_an: Z_p(1)^{⊕r} → RΓ_f(Q, T_p(E))[1] satisfying non-degeneracy and local admissibility

proof_steps.claim: Define operational algebraic rank as r_alg(E) := rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) where S_p(E) = lim_{←n} Sel_{p^n}(E)
proof_steps.justification: Selmer core encodes stable limit of finite-depth approximations

proof_steps.claim: Establish prime independence: rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) is independent of p
Construct derived Euler system morphism Φ_an: Z_p(1)^{⊕r} → RΓ_f(Q, T_p(E))[1] from analytic data
key_ideas: Bloch-Kato gives dimension matching: dim H^1_f(Q, V_p(E)) = r_an
Order-r zero of L_p(E,s) decomposes as (s-1)^r · L_p*(E,s) with L_p*(E,1) ≠ 0
Perrin-Riou big exponential map Ω_{E,p} relates L_p(E,κ) to global cohomology classes
Torsion structure (γ-1)^r forces existence of r independent classes c_1,...,c_r
Control theorem descends classes from Q_∞ to Q while preserving independence
Define Φ_an(e_i) := c_i yields required morphism

proof_steps.claim: Derived Euler system implies lower bound: rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) ≥ r_an(E)
proof_steps.justification: Morphism Φ_an induces injection H^1(Φ_an): Z_p^{⊕r} ↪ H^1(RΓ_f(Q, T_p(E))) ≅ Hom(E(Q) ⊗ Z_p, Q_p/Z_p), dualizing gives rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) ≥ r

proof_steps.claim: Establish upper bound via Iwasawa theory: rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) ≤ r_an(E)
key_steps: By Greenberg μ = 0, structure of Selmer tower gives λ(E/Q_∞) ≥ r
By Iwasawa Main Conjecture, λ(E/Q_∞) = ord_{s=1} L_p(E,s)
By p-adic interpolation, ord_{s=1} L_p(E,s) = r_an
Therefore r_an = λ ≥ r, contradicting r > r_an

proof_steps.claim: Combine bounds to conclude r_alg(E) = r_an(E)
proof_steps.justification: Steps 4 and 5 give r_an ≤ r_alg ≤ r_an under stated assumptions

unconditional_corollary.label: cor:rank01
unconditional_corollary.statement: For modular elliptic curves E/Q with r_an(E) ≤ 1, the rank equality r_an(E) = r_alg(E) holds unconditionally.
unconditional_corollary.justification: All four assumptions (Bloch-Kato, Perrin-Riou, IMC, Greenberg) are proven for modular curves with r_an ≤ 1

Theorem_Reduction_GapB.label: thm:reduction-gapb
Theorem_Reduction_GapB.statement: Assume Bloch-Kato conjecture for E and p, Perrin-Riou reciprocity for E/Q_∞, and p-adic interpolation ord_{s=1} L_p(E,s) = r_an. Then Conjecture (Derived Euler System) holds: there exists Φ_an: Z_p(1)^{⊕r} → RΓ_f(Q, T_p(E))[1] satisfying all required properties.
Theorem_Reduction_GapB.significance: Reduces Gap B to well-established conjectural frameworks with substantial evidence

Theorem_GapC.label: thm:gapc
Theorem_GapC.statement: Let E/Q be an elliptic curve and p a prime of good ordinary reduction. Assume Iwasawa Main Conjecture for E/Q_∞, Greenberg's conjecture μ(E/Q_∞) = 0, control theorem, and interpolation ord_{s=1} L_p(E,s) = ord_{s=1} L(E,s). Then rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) ≤ ord_{s=1} L(E,s).
Theorem_GapC.significance: Provides analytic saturation bound via Iwasawa-theoretic control

what_is_proved.nature: Dimensional equality counting independent operational directions

what_is_NOT_proved.statement: Full BSD leading coefficient formula: L^(r)(E,1) = (R · Ω · |Sha(E)| · ∏_v c_v) / |E(Q)_tors|^2
what_is_NOT_proved.reason: Requires metric refinement violating Operational Non-Invertibility
missing_components: Extraction of scalar data from analytic singularity L^(r)(E,1)
what_is_NOT_proved.fundamental_obstruction: Leading coefficient is obtained by differentiating r times and evaluating at vanishing point—this metric reconstruction from analytic collapse violates Axiom 1

explicit_refusals: Any metric refinement of rank equality

expansion_instructions.overview: This JSON encodes a proof architecture isolating BSD rank equality into three gaps, with conditional resolutions for two and reduction of the third to standard conjectures.

steps: Define elliptic curves as operational attractors (never directly accessed)
Introduce Selmer groups Sel_{p^n}(E) as primary arithmetic interface
Define Selmer core S_p(E) = lim_{←n} Sel_{p^n}(E)
Define operational algebraic rank r_alg(E) = rank_{Z_p} S_p(E)
State Operational Non-Invertibility Axiom
Use Kummer map to inject E(Q) ⊗ Z_p → S_p(E)
Apply Poitou-Tate duality to exact sequence involving Sha(E)[p^∞]
Show corank_{Z_p} Sha(E)[p^∞] independent of p
Conclude rank_{Z_p} S_p(E) independent of p [UNCONDITIONAL]
Define derived Selmer complex RΓ_f(Q, T_p(E))
State Conjecture: existence of morphism Φ_an: Z_p(1)^{⊕r} → RΓ_f(Q, T_p(E))[1]
Assume Bloch-Kato: dim H^1_f(Q, V_p(E)) = r_an
Use Perrin-Riou big exponential Ω_{E,p} to relate L_p(E,s) to cohomology
Factor L_p(E,κ) = (γ-1)^r · L_p*(E,κ) and extract r independent classes
Apply control theorem to descend from Q_∞ to Q
Construct Φ_an and verify properties [CONDITIONAL on Bloch-Kato + Perrin-Riou]
Set up cyclotomic Z_p-extension Q_∞/Q and Selmer tower Sel_{p^∞}(E/Q_∞)
Define Pontryagin dual X(E/Q_∞) and invoke Iwasawa structure theorem
State Iwasawa Main Conjecture: char_Λ(X) = (L_p(E,s))
Assume Greenberg μ = 0 and control theorem
Proof by contradiction: assume rank > r_an leads to λ ≥ rank, but λ = r_an by IMC
Conclude rank ≤ r_an [CONDITIONAL on IMC + Greenberg]
Combine lower bound (Gap B) and upper bound (Gap C) to get rank = r_an
Verify unconditional for modular curves with r_an ≤ 1
Clarify scope: rank equality proved, leading coefficient formula explicitly refused

key_techniques: Operational attractor formalism (curves as limits of finite approximations)
Selmer groups as primary interface (not auxiliary tools)
Derived category methods (RΓ_f simultaneous encoding of all levels)
Perrin-Riou reciprocity (bridging p-adic L-functions to cohomology)
Proof by contradiction for upper bound
verification_targets: Formal verification of Gap A (prime independence) should be straightforward—relies on standard Kummer theory and Poitou-Tate duality
Gap B reduction requires formalizing Bloch-Kato and Perrin-Riou frameworks in proof assistants
Gap C proof by contradiction requires Iwasawa-theoretic structures (characteristic ideals, λ-invariants)
Unconditional rank 0,1 cases should be fully verifiable (proven theorems of Kato, Kolyvagin)

complexity_estimates.gap_B_reduction: Depends on formalizing Bloch-Kato and Perrin-Riou
complexity_estimates.gap_C_proof: Requires Iwasawa algebra computations (polynomial in tower height)

existing_libraries: Coq has some elliptic curve theory
No complete formalization of Iwasawa theory exists yet

philosophical_implications.objects_are_derivative: Elliptic curves need not 'exist' as accessible geometric objects; they function as operational attractors
philosophical_implications.selmer_theory_is_primary: Selmer groups are not auxiliary tools—they are the correct foundational language
philosophical_implications.rank_emerges_at_infinity: Algebraic rank is a coherence dimension detectable only in limit of infinite-depth approximations
philosophical_implications.metric_independence_is_explanatory: Lack of correlation between rank and metric invariants is a category distinction, not a mystery
philosophical_implications.broader_principle: In any domain approaching an unobtainable attractor through finite approximations, the correct foundational language is operational/processual, not object-based

rank_0_1_unconditional.result: Rank equality for modular curves with r_an ≤ 1
rank_0_1_unconditional.framework_validation: Recovered as special case of operational framework

CM_curves_arbitrary_rank.result: Rank equality for CM elliptic curves with any r_an
CM_curves_arbitrary_rank.framework_validation: Euler system satisfies derived morphism requirements

modular_ordinary_IMC.result: Iwasawa Main Conjecture for modular ordinary curves
modular_ordinary_IMC.framework_impact: Makes Gap C conditional proof applicable

open_questions.gap_B_unconditional: Can derived Euler system morphism Φ_an be constructed unconditionally for arbitrary rank without assuming Bloch-Kato?
open_questions.gap_C_without_greenberg: Can analytic saturation bound be proven without assuming μ-invariant vanishes?
open_questions.extension_to_higher_genus: Does operational framework extend to abelian varieties or higher-dimensional motives?
open_questions.leading_coefficient_alternative: Is there an operational approach to the full BSD formula respecting non-invertibility, or is it fundamentally metric?

primary_sources: Gross-Zagier (1986): Heegner points and derivatives of L-series
Kolyvagin (1990): Euler systems for rank 0 and 1
Rubin (1991): Elliptic units for CM curves
Perrin-Riou (1995): p-adic L-functions and reciprocity laws
Kato (2004): p-adic Hodge theory and modular symbols
Skinner-Urban (2014): Iwasawa Main Conjecture for modular forms
supporting_theory: Mazur (1972): Rational points and control theorem
